Ghostface Killah Announces “36 Seasons” Album, Shares Song “Love Don’t Live Here No More”

posted by Andres Tardio on November 11, 2014 in Audio, News

Ghostface Killah is set to release a new comic book-themed album, 36 Seasons, set to be released December 9 on Salvation/Tommy Boy.

While Kool G Rap and Pharoahe Monch join Ghost as featured acts, AZ is the album’s most prolific guest, appearing on a handful of tracks. The Revelations handle the production for this effort with The 45 King and M.O.P.’s Fizzy Womack are among the project’s co-producers.

Wu-Tang Clan’s Ghost’s “Love Don’t Live Here No More” has been released as the album’s first single, which you can hear below.

The project, which comes before Ghost’s BADBADNOTGOOD album, is set to be released along with a 20-page booklet crafted by Matthew Rosenberg, who also made Ghostface’s 2013 mini comic book “Twelve Reasons to Die,” which was released with Ghost’s Adrian Younge-produced critically acclaimed album by the same name.

The tracklist for 36 Seasons is below:

1. “The Battlefield” [GFK / Kool G Rap / AZ / Tre Williams]
2. “Love Don’t Live Here No More” [GFK / Kandace Springs]
3. “Here I Go Again” [GFK / AZ / Rell]
4. “Loyalty” [Kool G Rap / Nems]
5. “It’s A Thin Line Between Love And Hate” [The Revelations]
6. “The Dog’s of War” [GFK / Shawn Wigs / Kool G Rap]
7. “Emergency Procedure” [GFK / Pharoahe Monch]
8. “Double Cross” [GFK / AZ]
9. “Bamboo’s Lament” [Kandace Springs]
10. “Pieces of the Puzzle” [GFK / AZ]
11. “Homicide” [GFK / Nems / Shawn Wigs]
12. “Blood in the Streets” [GFK / AZ]
13. “Call My Name” [GFK]
14. “I Love You For All Seasons” [The Revelations]
